description:
64bit instances launched on ESX via the VCDriver will not support running 64bit guests.

There is an option that can be passed during the vmx creation that will allow for this to happen.

This is very useful if you want to run hypervisors (esx, kvm) on top of ESX and then run 64bit VMs on top of those hypervisors.
title: No support for double nested 64 bit guest using VCDriver

comments.content:
64bit instances launched on ESX via the VCDriver will not support running 64bit guests.

There is an option that can be passed during the vmx creation that will allow for this to happen.

This is very useful if you want to run hypervisors (esx, kvm) on top of ESX and then run 64bit VMs on top of those hypervisors.

commit 8f6419301e56f7104bc9ac76dcd2ba5aeed0cb43
Author: Jacob Cherkas <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jun 18 10:22:10 2013 -0700

    No support for double nested 64 bit guest using VCDriver
    
    64bit instances launched on ESX via the VCDriver will not
    support running 64bit guests. There is an option that can
    be passed during the vmx creation that will allow for this
    to happen. This is very useful if you want to run hypervisors
     (esx, kvm) on top of ESX and then run 64bit VMs on top of
    those hypervisors.
    
    Fixes bug 1192256
    
    Change-Id: Id6eb224c97569737cbb41f1b64f61805e1df004e
